intro: Mikania marinii, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its rapid growth and trailing habit. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in disturbed habitats. Due to its invasive potential, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural and natural areas.
